intro: Arctium falconeri, commonly known as the Falkland Islands burdock, is a flowering plant native to the Falkland Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces spiny, bur-like fruits that aid in seed dispersal by attaching to animals. It thrives in coastal and grassland habitats, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Arctium falconeri is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native environment.
